description: Calculates the age of the robot in years based on installation date and record timestamp.
definition: For a given robot R, let D be the instdateval from robot_details where botdetreg = R, and T be the rects from robot_record where recreg = R. Then, RAY = \frac{(T - D).days}{365.25}

description: Calculates the average temperature of Joint 1 across all operations for a specific robot.
definition: For a given robot R, AJ1T = \frac{\sum_{jc \in \text{joint_condition} \mid \text{jcdetref = R}} j1tempval}{|\{jc \in \text{joint_condition} \mid \text{jcdetref = R}\}|}

description: Finds the maximum temperature recorded for any joint across all operations for a specific robot.
definition: For a given robot R, MJT = \max_{jc \in \text{joint_condition} \mid \text{jcdetref = R}} \max(jc.j1tempval, jc.j2tempval, jc.j3tempval, jc.j4tempval, jc.j5tempval, jc.j6tempval)

description: Calculates the average position error across all actuations for a specific robot.
definition: For a given robot R, APE = \frac{\sum_{ad \in \text{actuation_data} \mid \text{actdetref = R}} poserrmmval}{|\{ad \in \text{actuation_data} \mid \text{actdetref = R}\}|}

description: Calculates the average speed of the Tool Center Point across all actuations for a specific robot.
definition: For a given robot R, ATCS = \frac{\sum_{ad \in \text{actuation_data} \mid \text{actdetref = R}} tcpspeedval}{|\{ad \in \text{actuation_data} \mid \text{actdetref = R}\}|}

description: The fault prediction score from the most recent maintenance record for a robot.
definition: For a given robot R, \text{faultpredscore}(mf) \text{ where } mf \in \text{maintenance_and_fault}, \text{upkeeprobot} = R, \text{and } \text{upkeepduedays}(mf) = \min_{mf' \in \text{maintenance_and_fault} \mid \text{upkeeprobot} = R} \text{upkeepduedays}(mf').

description: Finds the minimum Remaining Useful Life across all maintenance records for a specific robot.
definition: For a given robot R, MRUL = \min_{mf \in \text{maintenance_and_fault} \mid \text{upkeeprobot = R}} rulhours

description: The maximum total operating hours recorded for the robot across all operations.
definition: For a given robot R, TOH = \max_{o \in \text{operation} \mid \text{operbotdetref = R}} totopshrval

description: Counts the number of operation records for a specific robot.
definition: For a given robot R, NO = |\{o \in \text{operation} \mid \text{operbotdetref = R}\}|

description: Sums the program cycle counts across all operations for a specific robot.
definition: For a given robot R, TPC = \sum_{o \in \text{operation} \mid \text{operbotdetref = R}} progcyclecount

description: Indicates if a robot is old based on its age.
definition: A robot is considered old if RAY >= 2.

description: Indicates if Joint 1 has a high average temperature.
definition: Joint 1 has high temperature if AJ1T > 50.

description: Indicates if there is a risk of overheating based on maximum joint temperature.
definition: There is an overheating risk if MJT > 70.

description: Categorizes the precision of the robot based on average position error.
definition: If APE < 0.1, 'High Precision'; else if APE < 0.5, 'Medium Precision'; else 'Low Precision'.

description: Indicates if the robot operates at high speed based on average TCP speed.
definition: The robot is fast if ATCS > 1000.

description: Indicates if the robot has a high risk of fault based on average fault prediction score.
definition: The robot has high fault risk if RFPS > 0.5.

description: Indicates if urgent maintenance is needed based on minimum Remaining Useful Life.
definition: Urgent maintenance is needed if MRUL < 100.

description: Indicates if the robot has been heavily used based on total operating hours.
definition: The robot is heavily used if TOH > 10000.

description: Indicates if the robot has performed multiple operations.
definition: The robot has performed multiple operations if NO > 1.

description: Indicates if the robot has a high total program cycle count.
definition: The robot has a high cycle count if TPC > 1000000.

description: Illustrates the temperature values of robot joints.
definition: Joint temperatures are measured in degrees Celsius. Typical operating temperatures range from 20°C to 60°C. Temperatures above 60°C may indicate potential issues.

description: Illustrates the vibration levels of robot joints.
definition: Vibration levels are measured in units such as mm/s. Higher values may indicate wear or misalignment.

description: Illustrates the position error in robot actuations.
definition: Position error is measured in millimeters. Lower values indicate higher precision.

description: Illustrates the speed of the Tool Center Point.
definition: TCP speed is measured in mm/s. Higher speeds may be required for certain applications but can affect precision.

description: Illustrates the fault prediction score in maintenance records.
definition: The score ranges from 0 to 1, with higher values indicating a higher likelihood of an impending fault.

description: Illustrates the Remaining Useful Life in maintenance records.
definition: RUL is measured in hours and indicates the estimated time until the next maintenance is required.

description: Illustrates the safety state of the robot.
definition: Possible states include 'Normal', 'Warning', and 'Emergency', indicating the current safety condition.

description: Illustrates the number of emergency stops recorded.
definition: A higher number of emergency stops may indicate operational issues or safety concerns.

description: Illustrates the tool wear percentage.
definition: Tool wear is expressed as a percentage, with 100% indicating the tool needs replacement.

description: Illustrates the load value of the system controller.
definition: Controller load is a measure of CPU or system load, typically ranging from 0 to 100%.

description: Calculates a weighted average fault prediction score, prioritizing recent records.
definition: For a given robot R, WFPS = \frac{\sum_{mf \in \text{maintenance_and_fault} \mid \text{upkeeprobot = R}} (faultpredscore \cdot w(mf))}{\sum_{mf \in \text{maintenance_and_fault} \mid \text{upkeeprobot = R}} w(mf)}, \text{where } w(mf) = 1 / (1 + \text{upkeepduedays})

description: Measures energy efficiency by comparing energy usage to operating hours.
definition: For a given robot R, EER = \frac{\sum_{ps \in \text{performance_and_safety} \mid \text{effectivenessrobot = R}} energyusekwhval}{\text{TOH}}, \text{where TOH is used to normalize energy consumption.}

description: Computes a composite index of joint health based on temperature and vibration.
definition: For a given robot R, JDI = \frac{\sum_{jc \in \text{joint_condition} \mid \text{jcdetref = R}} \sum_{i=1}^6 (jitempval_i / \text{MJT} + jivibval_i)}{\text{|}\{jc \in \text{joint_condition} \mid \text{jcdetref = R}\}| \cdot 6}, \text{where MJT normalizes temperatures, and jitempval_i, jivibval_i are joint i's temperature and vibration.}

description: Calculates the efficiency of program cycles relative to cycle time.
definition: For a given robot R, OCE = \frac{\text{TPC}}{\sum_{o \in \text{operation} \mid \text{operbotdetref = R}} cycletimesecval}

description: Aggregates safety incidents from JSONB safety_metrics.
definition: For a given robot R, SIS = \sum_{ps \in \text{performance_and_safety} \mid \text{effectivenessrobot = R}} (safety_metrics->>'overloads'::int + safety_metrics->>'collisions'::int + safety_metrics->>'emergency_stops'::int + safety_metrics->>'speed_violations'::int), \text{where JSONB fields are extracted and summed.}

description: Estimates the trend in maintenance costs over time.
definition: For a given robot R, MCT = \frac{\sum_{mf \in \text{maintenance_and_fault} \mid \text{upkeeprobot = R}} \text{upkeepcostest} \cdot w(mf)}{\text{|}\{mf \in \text{maintenance_and_fault} \mid \text{upkeeprobot = R}\}|}, \text{where } w(mf) = \frac{1}{1 + \text{upkeepduedays}}

description: Measures controller stress based on load and thermal metrics.
definition: For a given robot R, CSI = \frac{\sum_{sc \in \text{system_controller} \mid \text{systemoverseerrobot = R}} (controller_metrics->>'load_value'::float + controller_metrics->>'thermal_level'::float)}{\text{|}\{sc \in \text{system_controller} \mid \text{systemoverseerrobot = R}\}|}, \text{where JSONB fields load_value and thermal_level are averaged.}

description: Estimates the rate of tool wear relative to program cycles.
definition: For a given robot R, TWR = \frac{\sum_{ps \in \text{performance_and_safety} \mid \text{effectivenessrobot = R}} toolwearpct}{\text{TPC}}, \text{where TPC normalizes tool wear percentage.}

description: Calculates the variance of joint torques to assess operational stability.
definition: For a given robot R, JTV = \frac{\sum_{jp \in \text{joint_performance} \mid \text{jperfdetref = R}} \sum_{i=1}^6 ((joint_metrics->>'jointi'->>'torque'::float - \mu_i)^2)}{\text{|}\{jp \in \text{joint_performance} \mid \text{jperfdetref = R}\}| \cdot 6}, \text{where } \mu_i = \frac{\sum_{jp} joint_metrics->>'jointi'->>'torque'::float}{\text{|}\{jp\}|}, \text{and jointi is joint i's metrics.}

description: Measures how close the robot operates to its payload capacity.
definition: For a given robot R, PUR = \frac{\sum_{ad \in \text{actuation_data} \mid \text{actdetref = R}} payloadwval}{\text{(robot_details.payloadcapkg where botdetref = R)} \cdot \text{|}\{ad \in \text{actuation_data} \mid \text{actdetref = R}\}|}, \text{where RAY adjusts for age-related capacity changes if applicable.}

description: Classifies robots into maintenance priority categories based on fault prediction scores and remaining useful life
definition:
For a robot R, the Maintenance Priority Level is:
- 'CRITICAL' if WFPS > 0.6 AND MRUL < 500
- 'WARNING' if WFPS > 0.4 OR MRUL < 500
- 'NORMAL' otherwise

description: Flags robots with poor energy efficiency.
definition: A robot R is Energy Inefficient if EER > 0.01 and TOH > 1000.

description: Indicates robots at risk of joint failure.
definition: A robot R has Joint Health Risk if JDI > 1.5 and MJT > 65.

description: Categorizes robots based on their program cycle efficiency performance
definition:
For a robot R, the Cycle Efficiency Category is:
- 'Low Efficiency' if OCE < 100 AND TPC > 500000
- 'Medium Efficiency' if OCE < 150 OR TPC > 300000
- 'High Efficiency' otherwise

description: Flags robots with significant safety incidents.
definition: A robot R has High Safety Concern if SIS > 20.

description: Identifies robots with rising maintenance costs.
definition: A robot R has Escalating Maintenance Costs if MCT > 500 and RAY > 2.

description: Indicates robots with stressed controllers.
definition: A robot R has Controller Overload Risk if CSI > 100 and NO > 2.

description: Classifies robots into tool replacement priority categories based on tool wear rate and program cycles
definition:
For a robot R, the Tool Replacement Status is:
- 'URGENT' if TWR > 0.001 AND TPC > 10000
- 'WARNING' if TWR > 0.0005 OR average tool wear percentage > 75
- 'NORMAL' otherwise

description: Identifies robots with unstable joint performance.
definition: A robot R has Operational Instability if JTV > 50 and MJT > 60.

description: Flags robots operating near or beyond payload capacity.
definition: A robot R is Overloaded if PUR > 0.9 and RAY > 1.

description: Measures the linear relationship between Joint Degradation Index and Total Operating Hours using regression.
definition: For a set of robots meeting JDI > 1.5, MJT > 65, and TOH > 5000, the JDI-TOH Regression Slope is given by \[ \text{slope} = \frac{n \sum (x_i y_i) - \sum x_i \sum y_i}{n \sum x_i^2 - (\sum x_i)^2} \] where \( y_i = \text{JDI} \) (Joint Degradation Index for robot \( i \)), \( x_i = \text{TOH} \) (Total Operating Hours for robot \( i \)), \( n \) is the number of qualifying robots, and sums are over all qualifying robots.

description: Calculates the average time in seconds for completing one program cycle
definition: For a given robot R, Average Cycle Time = \frac{\sum_{o \in \text{operation} \mid \text{operbotdetref = R}} \text{cycletimesecval}}{|\{o \in \text{operation} \mid \text{operbotdetref = R}\}|}

description: Ranks the Energy Efficiency Ratio within each application type to assess relative efficiency.
definition: EER Rank = \text{PERCENT_RANK}() \text{ OVER } (\text{PARTITION BY } apptypeval \text{ ORDER BY } EER \text{ DESC})}

description: Ranks the Average Position Error within each controller type to assess relative precision.
definition: For a given robot R, APE Rank = \text{PERCENT_RANK}() \text{ OVER } (\text{PARTITION BY } ctrltypeval \text{ ORDER BY } APE \text{ DESC})

description: Ranks programs based on their average Operation Cycle Efficiency across robots.
definition: For a program P, Program Efficiency Rank = \text{DENSE_RANK}() \text{ OVER } (\text{ORDER BY } \text{AVG(program_oce)} \text{ DESC}), \text{where program_oce is the Operation Cycle Efficiency for program P on each robot.}

description: Aggregates efficiency-related metrics, including the most efficient program and average program Operation Cycle Efficiency.
definition: For a model series, Efficiency Metrics = \text{jsonb_build_object}('most_efficient_program', \text{currprogval with Program Efficiency Rank = 1}, 'avg_program_efficiency', \text{AVG(avg_program_oce)}), \text{where avg_program_oce is the average Operation Cycle Efficiency per program.}

description: The number of distinct robots within a specific group (e.g., model series).
definition: Let M be the model series, \mathcal{R}_M be the set of unique robot identifiers in M. Then Robot Count = |\mathcal{R}_M|

description: The average of the Average Position Error values for all robots within a specific model series.
definition: Let M be the model series, \mathcal{R}_M be the set of unique robot identifiers in M. Then Model Avg Pos Error = \frac{\sum_{R \in \mathcal{R}_M} \text{APE}(R)}{|\mathcal{R}_M|}

description: The average of the Average TCP Speed values for all robots within a specific model series.
definition: Let M be the model series, \mathcal{R}_M be the set of unique robot identifiers in M. Then Model Avg TCP Speed = \frac{\sum_{R \in \mathcal{R}_M} \text{ATCS}(R)}{|\mathcal{R}_M|}

description: The average of the maximum Total Operating Hours recorded for each robot within a specific model series.
definition: Let M be the model series, \mathcal{R}_M be the set of unique robot identifiers in M. Then Model Avg Max Ops Hours = \frac{\sum_{R \in \mathcal{R}_M} \text{TOH}(R)}{|\mathcal{R}_M|}
